member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4DecompressionStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4DecompressionStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: [NotSupported] Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4DecompressionStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support both writing and seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4DecompressionStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: [NotSupported] Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: The sum of and is greater than the buffer length.
is null.
or is negative.
An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support writing.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.summary: Unpacked buffer

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4DecompressionStream.Fill
member.summary: Fills or refills the read buffer.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4DecompressionStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: The sum of and is larger than the buffer length.
is null.
or is negative.
An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4DecompressionStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.LZ4_compress(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Native method call (PInvoke) to the LZ4_compress method. The platform target (X86 or X64) is chosen at runtime. Description: Compresses 'isize' bytes from 'source' into 'dest'. Destination buffer must be already allocated, and must be sized to handle worst cases situations (input data not compressible) Worst case size evaluation is provided by function LZ4_compressBound(). note : destination buffer must be already allocated. To avoid any problem, size it to handle worst cases situations (input data not compressible) Worst case size evaluation is provided by function LZ4_compressBound() (see "lz4.h")
member.param: The source (input).
The destination (output). Its memory must alredy be allocated, use LZ4_compressBound for the size hint.
The source size. Max supported value is ~1.9GB.
member.returns: The number of bytes written in buffer destination.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.LZ4_compressHC(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Native method call (PInvoke) to the LZ4_compressHC method. It provide a High Compression mode that is slower but with a better compression rate. The platform target (X86 or X64) is chosen at runtime. Description: Compresses 'isize' bytes from 'source' into 'dest'. Destination buffer must be already allocated, and must be sized to handle worst cases situations (input data not compressible) Worst case size evaluation is provided by function LZ4_compressBound(). note : destination buffer must be already allocated. To avoid any problem, size it to handle worst cases situations (input data not compressible) Worst case size evaluation is provided by function LZ4_compressBound() (see "lz4.h")
member.param: The source (input).
The destination (output). Its memory must alredy be allocated, use LZ4_compressBound for the size hint.
The source size. Max supported value is ~1.9GB.
member.returns: The number of bytes written in buffer destination.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.LZ4_uncompress(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Native method call (PInvoke) to the LZ4_uncompress method. The platform target (X86 or X64) is chosen at runtime. Description: note : destination buffer must be already allocated. its size must be a minimum of 'osize' bytes.
member.param: The source (input).
The destination (output). Its memory must alredy be allocated, use LZ4_compressBound for the size hint.
Size of the original buffer. Is the output size, therefore the original size.
member.returns: the number of bytes read in the source buffer (in other words, the compressed size) If the source stream is malformed, the function will stop decoding and return a negative result, indicating the byte position of the faulty instruction This function never writes outside of provided buffers, and never modifies input buffer.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.LZ4_compressBound(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides the maximum size that LZ4 may output in a "worst case" scenario (input data not compressible) primarily useful for memory allocation of output buffer.
member.param: is the input size. Max supported value is ~1.9GB.
member.returns: maximum output size in a "worst case" scenario.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.CompressBytes(System.Byte[],Lz4Net.Lz4Mode)
member.summary: Compresses the byte buffer. This method stores a 8-byte header to store the original and compressed buffer size.
member.param: The data to be compressed.
The compression mode [Fast, HighCompression].
member.returns: The compressed byte array

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.CompressBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,Lz4Net.Lz4Mode)
member.summary: Compresses the byte buffer. This method stores a 8-byte header to store the original and compressed buffer size.
member.param: The data to be compressed.
The offset.
The length.
The compression mode [Fast, HighCompression].
member.returns: The compressed byte array
member.exception: If length if outside data array bounds

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.Compress(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[]@,Lz4Net.Lz4Mode)
member.summary: Compresses the byte buffer. This method stores a 8-byte header to store the original and compressed buffer size.
member.param: The data to be compressed.
The offset.
The length.
The compression buffer. If the buffer is null or the size is insuficient, a new array will be created.
The compression mode [Fast, HighCompression].
member.returns: The compressed byte array

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.DecompressBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decompresses the byte buffer compressed by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.Compress method. This method uses the byte array header info to correctly prepare the output buffer.
member.param: The compressed data returned by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.Compress method.
member.returns: The uncompressed buffer

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.Decompress(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Decompresses the byte buffer compressed by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.Compress method. This method uses the byte array header info to correctly prepare the output buffer.
member.param: The compressed data returned by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.Compress method.
The data buffer offset.
The decompression buffer. If the buffer is null or the size is insuficient, a new array will be created.
member.returns: Uncompressed data size
member.exception: Input data is incomplete. Data header info size is lesser than total array size

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.CompressString(System.String,Lz4Net.Lz4Mode)
member.summary: Compresses the specified text and return a Base64 enconded string.
member.param: The text.
The compression mode [Fast, HighCompression].
member.returns: The compressed text as a Base64 enconded string

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.DecompressString(System.String)
member.summary: Decompresses the specified compressed text by the Lz4.CompressString method.
member.param: The compressed text.
member.returns: The decompressed string
member.exception: Input data is incomplete or was not generated by 'CompressString'.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.GetCompressedSize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Size of the compressed buffer returned by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.CompressBytesHC method.
member.param: The buffer returned by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.CompressBytesHC method.

member.name: M:Lz4Net.Lz4.GetUncompressedSize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Size of the original (uncompressed) buffer returned by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.CompressBytesHC method.
member.param: The buffer returned by a Lz4.CompressBytes or Lz4.CompressBytesHC method.

member.name: F:Lz4Net.Lz4Mode.Fast
member.summary: The very fast Lz4 algorithm implemtation.

member.name: F:Lz4Net.Lz4Mode.HighCompression
member.summary: A High Compression mode that is slower but with a better compression rate.
